newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: BTR DUNLOP TO BUY BTR INT'L ASSETS.
newsitem.headline: BTR DUNLOP TO BUY BTR INT'L ASSETS.

text.p: South African tyre and industrial rubber goods concern BTR Dunlop Ltd said on Friday it had agreed to buy BTR Plc's international tyre interests for 94 million rand, to be settled by the issue of 14.46 new shares of 650 cents.

The deal includes rights to the Dunlop automotive trademark in some 70 countries -- mainly in Africa, Latin America and Malaysia -- and the Remington, Regent and John Bull trademarks in certain countries.

BTR Dunlop will also take a 75 percent effective share in Dunlop Zimbabwe Ltd, 38 percent of Zimbabwean distributor Cobra Tyres (Private ) Ltd, 100 percent of Zimbabwean Rubber & Allied Products (Private) Ltd and 25.2 percent of Dunlop Nigeria Plc.
